title: girlfriend 23 who dubbed herself
story: Girlfriend, , who dubbed herself Fake Barbie, stabbed and murdered dad of threeOnlyFans star Abigail White has been charged with the murder of dad-of-three Bradley Lewis, , who was stabbed in their home last weekend and later died in hospitalOnlyFans model Abigail White has been charged with the murder of Bradley Lewis Image: InstagramByAntony ThrowerNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar A model known as Fake Barbie has been charged with the murder of her boyfriend. Abigail White, , allegedly stabbed partner Bradley Lewis to death at their home in Bristol on Friday, March . The dad of three was rushed to hospital for urgent treatment but died six hours later. A forensic post-mortem examination confirmed Bradley died from a single stab wound to the chest. OnlyFans star White appeared at Bristol Magistrates’ Court yesterday dressed to confirm her name, date of birth and address. His family released a loving tribute, which read: Our wonderful, much-loved son Bradley, taken from us too early. Other heartfelt tributes to the dad were posted on social media from former football teammates and friends.  Lee Parker wrote: Today we lost a fantastic beautul person, without saying goodbye. I hope he knows just how much and how many people loved him beautul throughout. Rip Brad. Adam Porter said: Rip Brad, will he missed. Loved playing football with you back at rovers. See you on the other side. Kailon Britt added she doesnapost knowsheaposs angry or devastated, claiming her emotions are everywhere.She said The circumstances are so heart breaking. “Your family will miss you soo much and those beautul children of yours are gonna miss you so much my brother. You have grown to be the man everyone wanted you to be, so respected and loved.” Bradley, a keen footballer, played for the reserve side of Hanham Athletic. The team held a minute’s silence before their - draw with Bromley Heath United and is planning on holding a fundraising match next month in his honour.  They said in a tribute: “HAFC are deeply saddened to advise that one of our Reserve Team players, Brad Lewis passed away yesterday. We remembered Brad with a minute’s silence before our fixture yesterday. Our deepest condolences to all of Bradaposs family and friends. Senior Investigating Officer DI Ben Lavender said: “Our investigation is continuing at pace and we have a team of officers and police staff working tirelessly to piece together the events which led up to this terrible incident. “The man’s family continue to be updated and fully supported by specially trained liaison officers and our thoughts are very much with them. “There continues to be a police presence at the scene of this incident and reassurance patrols are ongoing, so we’d encourage residents to please speak to officers with the local Neighbourhood Policing teamthey have any questions or concerns.”Follow MirrorFacebookTwitterMORE ON MurderCrime" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man britains smallest car says
story: Man with Britains smallest car reveals it costs just £ to fill upAlex Orchin can be seen around the village driving the worlds smallest car, but it can only fit one shopping bag insideThe mini car has a five litre petrol tank Image: James Linsell-Clark  SWNSByLauren BeavisLucy WilliamsonReporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsFuel prices have hit record highs recently as the rising cost of living continues to bite UK households. But one man might have cracked it - just have a very very tiny car. Meet Alex - the man with Britainaposs lowest fuel bill as he drives the worldaposs smallest car - which costs just £ to fill up. Alex Orchin, , can be seen trundling around his Sussex village on his daily chores in his quirky blue Peel P and he said it costs around £ or so to fill up. The car, which has only three wheels, is just cm long, cm wide and cm high and has a five litre petrol tank. And at ft ins, Alex fits comfortably in it too.  His car, a P, was first made on the Isle of Man in the s and in  were named the smallest production car ever built in the book of Guinness World Records. It has a top speed of just mph.Alex is an avid motoring collector and says became obsessed with the cars since watching Jeremy Clarkson drive one on Top Gear.He said: “I have always had an interest in old, vintage and unusual cars since I was a kid. aposaposNo one in my family was into it - it was a bit of a random obsession!  I used to be a chauffer for vintage cars and have had a  Model T and a  Morris Minor too. “I got fixated on this idea of having a P just because it was so tiny but when I saw an original was £, it kind of killed it off. “But about four years ago I bought one of the newer ones from the Isle of Man - so I’m only the second owner. The car always gets attention - it is quite staggering because to me itaposs just a tiny car.apos  Itaposs much smaller than you think it is - everyone says that when they see the car in person. I can fit a shopping bag down the left of the car by the handbrake, but nothing . The vehicle was built in  but is based on the original design from the first production models in the s.  The mini-motor allows Alex comfortable journeys to and from his home in Wivelsfield, Sussex. Last year he drove theof the UK in the car - starting his , mile journey from John OaposGroats on November  and arrived in Landaposs End on December . He was just in time for his three week goal - and raised over £, for Children in Need. Alex said: Iaposve owned a lot of cars and none of them get as much attention as this one. NormallyI pull up in a Morris Minor it is car people and enthusiasts that want to come and talk with me.  aposaposBut my Peel P attracts absolutely everyone, including people who arenapost interested in cars. They think itaposs so hilarious and children love it! The under ten year oldaposs especially go mad for it.aposapos The one-seater car is unable to fit a rucksack or a suitcase inside and forces Alexaposs knees to go on either side of the steering wheel.You can visit Alexaposs Youtube channel aposForward to The Pastapos here.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON YouTubeJeremy ClarksonChildren In NeedTop GearLoveWorld records" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: man left scar after partner
story: Man left with scar after partner yanked private parts in row over dinnerLuke Lal repeatedly punched his partner in the head then grabbed hold of his penis, causing a small laceration which required hospital treatmentLuke Lal Image: Birmingham LiveByRoss McCarthyGraeme Murray:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar A man was left with a scar after his partner aposyanked his penisapos during an argument over what to have for dinner, a court heard. Luke Lal later used dating app, to send abusive messages, one of which said the victimaposs sexuality would be told to his parents. Lal, , of Birmingham, West Midlands, had previously admitted assault and was given  months suspended sentence for  months and ordered to do  hours unpaid work.Michael Shaw, prosecuting, told Birmingham Crown Court the couple had been in a relationship for some time and there had been dficulties, reports BirminghamLive. During the argument Lal repeatedly punched his partner in the head then grabbed hold of his penis, causing a small laceration.  His partner later went to hospital where the injury was treated. A family court issued a non molestation order banning Lal from having contact with the victim. But the defendant later sent texts to him on an unregistered mobile phone and abusive messages after setting up a fake account of Grindr. In a statement the victim said what had happened had affected his mental health, family le and relationships.He said he had received counselling and that the scar reminded him of the trauma. He suffered from flashbacks and anxiety and depression and it had left him fuelled by anger. Sentencing, Judge Paul Farrer QC said that it had been a strained relationship and that the fault lay on both sides.He added: You and the victim argued and you attacked him and punched him to the head repeatedly.  You had your hands around his throat. You also grabbed his penis and pulled it forcibly about five times so it caused a one centimetre wound which was later glued and has left a scar. That the victim has found embarrassing. You sent a relatively large number of messages over a period of about four months. They were abusive and you threatened to reveal his sexuality to his parents, a threat that would have caused him severe distress. He added that the injury had been to a highly sensitive part of your victimaposs body.But he said he had taken into account that the incident happened over two years ago. Simon Cadwaladr, defending, said: This is set against a background of a relationship between two men that started with high hopes but quickly deteriorated.He said it had resulted in criminal proceedings being taken against both men. Mr Cadwaladr said the assault occurred after an argument over something as trivial as to what to have for dinner. Each of them were behaving in an extremely unfortunate manner towards each other in the emotional breakdown of their relationship. title: mums flat taken over hundreds
story: Mums flat taken over by hundreds of thousands of flies months after rat infestationThe woman, from Bristol, captured video footage of a vast amount of flies in her neighbours window and shared it on social mediaThe mum, named Caroline, has shared pictures of huge numbers of flies Image: Bristol Live WSByEllie Kendall:,  Mar |commentsA mum who claims her flat was infested with rats has now said that hundreds and thousands of flies have swarmed both her own and neighbouring homes. The woman, who wishes to simply be known as Caroline, captured video footage of a vast amount of flies in her neighbouraposs window and shared it on social media. She has hit out at Sovereign Housing - the association responsible for her block of flats in Bristol. Sovereign said in a statement that Carolineaposs neighbour has been confirmed to be safe and well following a welfare check. The company will be visiting the property today with Environmental Health to investigate the cause of the flies.Caroline told Bristol Live she had ed home at am on the morning of March  to find what she describes as hundreds and thousands of huge blue bottle flies inside her neighbours flat window, all trying to get out. She believed she probably hadnapost noticed it sooner because the weather hadnapost been warm or sunny before that day.She added: I knew something was dead in that flat and I have also not seen the owner for two years. I alerted Sovereign but got the standard email reply back that they have two weeks to even read the email. I have been woken at night by these huge horrible big flies in my bedroom lounge upstairs. There are three of us living in a two bedroom flat and I sleep in the lounge where I have made a little room for myself at the end. They frighten me because I donapost want them anywhere near me or my children. We just donapost seem to be getting any better and the stress of being ill and the constant cleaning, hoovering and washing is so exhausting. The children cannot attend school due to being so unwell and Iaposd personally like to thank Bristol Cathedral and Bristol Cathedral Choir School for their wonderful safeguarding advocates for contacting Sovereign Housing early this week as Sovereign had said it was a lease holder issue and they couldnapost get involved.  Back in January, Bristol Live reported on how terried Caroline had been after discovering rats in her flat - and how she had even resorted to cooking on her balcony to avoid attracting them. At the time, Caroline told Bristol Live that upon reporting it to the housing association, she was told they could find no evidence of rats.She said: I think itaposs pretty disgusting to say thataposs the end of it for us because there is no evidence, and yet youaposve got somebody whoaposs living here saying, aposbut they are in my ceilingapos. She later bought an endoscope camera and poked it through a hole in her ceiling and eventually captured on of the rats on video. At the time, Sovereign said they wanted all customers to feel safe and secure in their homes which is why weaposve arranged a number of visits from pest control firms to our shared ownership properties on Hotwell Road. Until very recently, we had not been provided with the video footage which could show where the rats are getting into the building, and we’re hopeful that this will help nail down the point of entry. We’ve been working closely with an officer from Bristol Environmental Health to resolve the issue, putting bait down around the scheme, since this was reported to us in November . We are also scheduling an independent appointment with a second pest control agency, which is due to take place as soon as possible. After Bristol Liveaposs report, Caroline said there seemed to be some action on Sovereignaposs part especially after Environmental Health also stepped in to help me in my plight to prove I was plagued with rats. She also described how Sovereign allowed Ecolab to have three visits but said: You canapost treat pest control effectively in three visits. Eleanor Lowman, regional home ownership manager at Sovereign, said: “We’d like to thank Caroline for expressing concern for her neighbour who we’re pleased to confirm is safe and well.“We’ll be visiting the property tomorrowwith Environmental Health to investigate the cause of the flies and to seek a resolution.“We’d always urge residents with concerns about the welfare of a neighbour to check on them, report it to us or ask the Police to do a welfare check.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Ecolab Inc.Public servicesHousing" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get email updates with the days biggest storiesInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: mum who used car battering
story: Mum who used car as battering ram while  times over drug limit spared jailNatalie Warke, , repeatedly rammed her VW Golf into her sisters empty car before pushing it across a junction during a family row in May  - police in Levenshulme, Manchester found Warke slumped at the wheelNatalie Warke was spared jail after testing  time the drug-driving limit Image: Cavendish PressLtdByAlahna KindredNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA mum-of-two has been spared jail after using her car as a battering ram while  times the drug-driving limit. Natalie Warke, , repeatedly rammed her VW Golf into her sisteraposs empty car before pushing it across a junction during a family row. Warke was arguing in the street with her eldest son and her sister about her vehicle being pranged. Stunned passers-by watched as she argued with her relatives in the street. Police were called to the scene in Levenshulme, Manchester found Warke slumped at the wheel of the car having snorted cocaine in the run-up to the incident, Manchester Crown Court said.  According to court documents tests showed she had mg of Benzoylecgonine- which is the main metabolite of cocaine - in her blood and she also had traces of cocaine itself in her system. The limit is mg. Warke admitted dangerous driving, drug driving, and having no insurance but walked free after a judge accepted a prison stretch would have a aposharmful effect on her -year-old son. The incident happened at am in May  when Warke got into a row with her sister and other relatives after one accidentally hit her car.  Warke had been diagnosed with epilepsy following a car crash in , the court heard. Andrew Mackintosh, prosecuting, said: This defendant was seen coming to a halt at a junction before driving into a small vehicle parked at the roadside. She pushed it back for a little distance then reversed and drove off only tofrom the opposite direction and push the other car across a road junction. The defendant was seen to get out of her vehicle and there was a disturbance involving other people and that resulted in her getting back into the car. Police arrived at the scene and found her sat in the driveraposs seat. She appeared to be slurring her words and was gurning at the officers who thought was intoxicated. Whilst they asked her for her keys, a member of the public approached them and showed CCTV of the incident. When interviewed the defendant accepted she had deliberately driven her Golf into the vehicles of other family members. She said this was following an argument with her son and several other members of the family. She admitted having driven into the parked car several times and said this was due to her son crashing his car into hers a short time before the incident. This is a case where some damage would have been caused to the other vehicle - however, the other members of the family who own that vehicle have never made a complaint or provided details of what happened. Warke had previous convictions for theft, the court heard. In mitigation defence counsel Andrew Molloy said his client is a single mum and has a son with special needs. Mr Molloy: She is somewhat embarrassed about her performance that day. This incident arose out of an argument and domestic tf she had with her sister. She thoroughly regrets her behaviour. Whilst what happened was unacceptable, there was no persons in the other vehicle and she was alone in her car. There were no pedestrians in the vicinity and very little in the way of traffic passing along the road. If she were to go to custody there would be repercussions for her son. Sentencing Warke, the judge Mr Recorder Michael Armstrong told her: You made a choice to drive whilst under the influence of drugs along a public street before ramming another family memberaposs vehicle on a number of occasions. But immediate custody would have a signicant harmful effect on others in particular your -year-old son. Warke was sentenced to nine months in jail suspended for  months and was ordered to complete  Rehabilitation Requirement Days. She was also banned from driving for two years. news uk-news new-highway-code-rules-mean-"New DVLA rules and driving laws coming in ByGraeme Murray:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments You could face a fine for using a mobile evenyouaposre a passenger under new Highway Code rules.Drivers who even touch a phone face could be hit with a £ penalty after tough new rules came into effect on Friday. If a person is supervising a driver who is learning, they could be hit with £, fine - as well as a massive six points on their licence. Current rules under the Highway Code make texting or calling while driving illegal. But new rules brought in on Friday means many grey areas have been tightened, making more actions illegal. In , it was ruled in the High Court that an offence was committed when a mobile was used for an interactive communication .  This included calling or texting, but now using a phone for any purpose, is seen as reckless and dangerous. Now drivers can no longer touch their device, take photos or videos, access playlists or use other apps while they drive. Phone use at traffic lights or in motorway queues will also be seen as illegal under new Highway Code rules. Anyone using a device while driving faces a £ fixed fine plus six points added to their driving licence. Motorists are, however, permitted to use their phones to pay at a drive-thru restaurant or a road or bridge toll. The Department of Transport : There will be an exemption to the new law for drivers making a contactless payment using their mobile phone while stationary to ensure the law keeps pace with technology.This exemption will cover, for example, places like a drive-through restaurant or a road toll, and will only apply when payment is being made with a card reader. It will not allow motorists to make general online payments while driving. Hands-free devices can be used when driving including taking calls or using a satnav, but onlyit is secured in something which holds it. title: prince andrews smug behaviour philips
story: Prince Andrews smug behaviour at Philips memorial once again lets down the QueenPrince Andrews public appearance alongside the Queen at Prince Philips memorial service today was arrogant, smug and tone deaf. He has let the Queen down once again, says Polly HudsonThe Duke of York, right, with his late father Prince Philip and mother Queen Elizabeth Image: Getty ImagesopinionByPolly Hudson:,  Mar |comments It doesn’t feel that controversial an opinion to say that I never want to see Prince Andrew again.Hard not to assume that most people feel the same way. So it seems impossible that Andrew, and those around him, aren’t aware of that. They must know exactly how popular he is, and that there is nothing that will ever change that.Of course Andrew is entitled to go to a memorial service for his father – but it is utterly tone deaf of him not to have read the room. He clearly should have slipped into the building quietly, sat somewhere discreet, tried to be as invisible as possible. To instead arrogantly rock up front and centre stage, even travelling in a car with the star of the show, is appalling behaviour, even by his standards.If his mother needed assistance on the journey, and down the aisle, there are plenty of other family members who could – who should – have been by her side instead.Andrew has let the poor Queen down, yet again, on what was already a testing day for many reasons. He shouldn’t have put her in that position, he should have insisted on travelling alone, being seated separately, definitely not in the front row, of all places.Sitting smugly in the hot seat makes it seem like he doesn’t understand the seriousness of what has happened, the cloud over him that will never go away – or that he simply doesn’t care. In reality it’s hardly a shock that Andrew hasn’t done the right thing –he was man of honour and integrity he would have nothing to apologise for. Which, let’s never forget, he never has. Palace insiders believe that after today he will effectively disappear from public le. Good riddance. Don’t let the palace door hit you on the way out.Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Kate Middleton, Duchess of CambridgePrince GeorgePrincess CharlottePrince Philip, Duke of EdinburghPrince Andrew, Duke of YorkRoyal FamilyThe Queen" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily royal round-up direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. news uk-news prince-harrys-pathetic-excuse-skipping-"Prince Harrys absence big disappointment says Richard GrfinByZoe ForseyFeatures Editor:,  Mar |comments Guests at the Duke of Edinburghaposs memorial service were discussing Prince Harry and Meghan Markleaposs decision to skip the event, with the late royalaposs former protection officer describing their excuse for not attending as nonsense. Richard Grfin, who was responsible for the safety of both the Queen and Prince Philip for  years, was a guest at todayaposs event but was disappointed the Duke and Duchess of Sussex decided against ing to the UK to pay their respects.Harry has said heaposs unable toto the UK due to safety concerns, which have become the subject of his latest legal battle - this time against the Home Office. Speaking to Sky News, Richard said: William had a great training from [Prince Philip] and is going to learn all his examples for him. Fingers crossed, I just hope Harry gets some of these things into his mind.Asked about his decision not to attend, he said: That was a big disappointment for everybody. He also said that members of the ,-strong congregation were discussing Harryaposs absence before the service began. He said: Certainly around where I was they thought he should have been here. All this nonsense about he couldnapost get protection, as far as Iaposm concerned that was a pathetic excuse, he should have been here to honour his grandfather. At the end of the day,he was that worried about security he could have stuck with his brother and father who have got wonderful security. He would have been more than safe.Richard worked for the royal family for over a decade and said todayaposs service captured the Duke perfectly. Speaking about todayaposs event, he said: To see the Queen come in and sit with her family, that was wonderful.It was very emotional. I worked with Prince Philip for  years and travelled the world with him, I did a lot of things with him and deeply missed him when he died.Prince Philip had a big footprint on the service, you could see it right the way through. It was fantastic to be able to come today and pay our respects. It was a wonderful, wonderful service. He was the most caring man you could possibly meet.  He also shared a story about when his son was diagnosed with cancer and Philip called the hospital to check on him. He also wrote to his we to check on her and on another occassion arranged transport so Mr Grfinaposs daughter could make it home Christmas. Todayaposs event paid tribute to Prince Philipaposs charity work and decades of service to the Queen and the royal family. The Dean of Westminster delivered a moving speech about the Duke. He said: He would hate to think that I should paint a picture of him as a ‘plaster saint’ someone without the usual human foibles and failings. He was far too self-aware ever to be taken in by flattery. Of course, it must be said that his le bore the marks of sacrice and service.  Certainly, he could show great sympathy and kindness. There is no doubt that he had a delightfully engaging, and often self-deprecating, sense of humour. It is quite clear that his mind held together both speculation and common sense. Moreover, nobody would ever doubt his loyalty and deep devotion to our Queen and to their family. Yet, there were times when he could be abrupt maybe, in robust conversation, forgetting just how intimidating he could be. A kind of natural reserve sometimes made him seem a little distant. He could be somewhat sharp in pricking what he thought to be bubbles of pomposity or sycophancy. On the other hand, we should not forget that he himself was sometimes wounded by being unfairly criticised or misunderstood. Like the rest of us, he was part of flawed humanity. Unlike most of us however, he was one of those rare people who remained true to, and guided by, what you might call ‘an inner spiritual compass’ a sense of being called to play a part in the making of a God-intended world. As we give thanks for the le of a remarkable man, perhaps out greatest tribute to him, most especially in these far too troubled times, will be for us to accept the challenge, implicit in his le, to rekindle in our hearts something of that call, and to prayfor the inspiration and the guidance to play our part, however small, in working for a kinder future. title: prince philips poignant last requests
story: Prince Philips poignant last requests will finally be honoured at memorial serviceSome of Prince Philips wishes for his funeral service that could not be fulfilled due to Covid- restrictions at the time of his final farewell will finally be granted at his memorial service later todayPrince Philips memorial service takes place at Westminster Abbey later today Image: Getty ImagesByJenner NewtonRoyal Features Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsSeveral of Prince Philipaposs poignant last requests will finally be honoured at his memorial service later today. When the Duke of Edinburgh, the beloved husband of the Queen, died last April aged , England was still in the grip of restrictions due to the Covid- pandemic. This meant his funeral, held on April  at St Georgeaposs Chapel in Windsor, was a much scaled-back service, with just  guests and no singing by the guests. It had been Philipaposs express wishes for the congregation to join and sing the rousing hymn Guide Me, O Thou Great Redeemer at his funeral.  Although the hymn was sung by a small choir, guests at his funeral were not allowed to join in. However, today, this request will finally be fulfilled at todayaposs service when the ,-strong congregation sing the hymn. In addition, Philip, who worked on his own funeral details – codenamed Forth Bridge – for many years, had asked for the choir to sing Te Deum in C by Benjamin Britten, and this will also be part of Tuesday’s proceedings.  Love the royals for the Mirroraposs daily newsletter to get all the latest news on the Queen, Charles, Kate, Wills, Meghan, Harry and the rest of The Firm. Click here to sign up . Meanwhile, clergy from Windsor, Sandringham and Balmoral will all play a special part in the service - at Philipaposs request. Philip had an active role in the day-to-day management of the estates for many years. He wanted the minister of Crathie Church near Balmoral, the rector of Sandringham and the chaplain to the Royal Chapel of All Saints, Windsor Great Park, to take part in his funeral - but Covid restrictions could not allow this.  Nearly all members of the Royal Family will be attending todayaposs event, including Prince Andrew, who will arrive alongside his daughters Princess Beatrice and Princess Eugenie, and their husbands Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi and Jack Brooksbank. Also there will be Prince Charles, Camilla, the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge, the Earl and Countess of Wessex and their children Lady Louise Windsor and Viscount Severn, the Princess Royal and Vice Admiral Sir Tim Laurence, Prince and Princess Michael of Kent, the Duke of Kent and the Duke and Duchess of Gloucester.  However, Prince Harry and Meghan Markle are not ing from the US for the service.Around  foreign royals will attend, including Prince Albert of Monaco, Denmark’s Queen Margrethe and Spain’s King Felipe VI and Queen Letizia, who would have originally been on the pre-pandemic guest list. Also invited are Sir David Attenborough, Dame Floella Benjamin, Baroness Grey-Thompson and members of the military who were involved in the funeral, including Pipe Major Colour Sergeant Peter Grant and the Grenadier Guards Bearer Party. title: queen made colossal mistake letting
story: Queen made colossal mistake by letting Prince Andrew to escort her to Philip memorialChoosing to be escorted to and from Westminster Abbey by a man who paid a reported £-million to settle a sordid sex case to avoid court was deeply distastefulPrince Andrew and the Queen arrive at the memorial service Image: PAopinionByKevin MaguireAssociate editor:,  Mar What a cynical, gratuitously offensive attempt by the Queen to rehabilitate shamed son Andrew. Buckingham Palace will calculate an elderly monarchaposs above criticism on the day of her dear, dead husbandaposs memorial service. But choosing to be escorted to and from Westminster Abbey by a man who paid a reported £-million to settle a sordid sex case to avoid court was deeply distasteful. It wasnapost a sweet old maaposam who wanted to travel from Windsor Castle in state limousine with a scoundrel shunned since paying off a woman who alleged when a teenager she was force to sleep with a dad of two old enough to be her own father.  This was an elderly monarch exploiting sympathy at a personal yet very public event to walk back into polite society a reviled man forced to give up even honorary membership of a posh golf club over the scandals spewing from a close friendship with a convicted paedophile and his jailed fixer. What Virginia Giuffre makes of it one can only imagine but much of the watching world, particularly women victims of abuse, will have been revolted. The removal of his military titles and royal patronages, including the use of a His Royal Highness title, look a ersion.  The Duke of York, her favourite son, remains promoted despite stomach-churning behaviour that shouldaposve seen tainted Andrew seated out of sight at the back behind a pillar. Perhaps age and frailty are distorting her judgement because this was a colossal mistake by a declining monarch. She put her son and family before decency, trying to sell a leper to the country at a service commemorating her husband. Knee-bending courtiers will struggle from now on to argue sheaposs principled and does what is right in the service of the country.  She held on to Andrewaposs arm but it was her parading him. He continues to deny the claim but embracing the humiliated sex case settler damaged her own reputation. After the disastrous royal colonial relic tour of the Caribbean, the head of the creaking institution also undermined a family business suddenly feeling very out of date. news uk-news schoolgirl--downs-syndrome-lands-"School girl with Downs Syndrome gets modelling job with BurberryByZahna EklundAudience writerLucy Notarantonio:,  Mar |comments A nine-year-old schoolgirl with Downaposs Syndrome has become the latest face of luxury fashion brand Burberry after landing a dream modelling job that sees her appear in the companyaposs spring summer  collection. Roni Littman, , is far from camera shy and has already modelled for the likes of River Island, Asda George, and TK Maxx - but her latest career move marks the first time she has appeared in a collection for a high-end designer.And Roniaposs mum Shelley, , couldnapost be more proud of her daughter, whom she says has blown all expectations out of the water after doctors told her parents she would never be able to do certain things because of her diagnosis.Shelley, from Potters Bar, Hertfordshire, said: We were absolutely elated when Roni got the Burberry modelling job.Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. I am so proud of her - she has blown all expectations out of the water. When she was born, we were told she may not be able to walk or talk. But she has defied the odds and continues to break boundaries. She has achieved so much in such a short period of time. We didnapost know Roni had Downaposs Syndrome until she was born. We were told she may never be able to do certain things and the doctors filled us with negativity. But she has proved everyone wrong.  Roniaposs mum also heaped praise on brands like Burberry who have chosen to encourage ersity and have become more inclusive with their advertisements. I am very impressed that high-end brands like Burberry are being inclusive as it is encouraging for other people with disabilities, she added, thereaposs no reason why children with disabilities shouldnapost have these things too. And while Roni - who has been signed with Zebedee Inclusive Talent Agency since  - is a natural in front of the camera, sheaposs also managed to pick up some other skills too - including skiing, which she has been doing since the age of five. Shelley explained: Roni did take a while to communicate clearly but she makes herself very much understood.  She is a very cheeky, determined and feisty young lady. She has always loved the camera and entertaining people. She started walking at  months old and has become a very determined inidual so Iaposm not surprised that she is excelling. Sometimes, it can be dficult for her as she takes longer to learn things but she never gives up. It is an honour and a privilege to have her in our lives. She learnt how to ski aged five and put her all into it. The Mirror is committed to more hopeful news. We recognise the news agenda can sometimes feel overwhelmingly negative.And while itaposs our job to keep you informed and hold those in power to account, we are making a commitment to also report more hopeful news. We will celebrate the people, places and movements that are bringing good into the world and, more than that, we will dig beneath the surface of important issues with the aim of finding hope.We will be firm in our convictions - but always fair-minded. By sharing solutions to problems, we can do more good and feel better about the world around us. Because we believe you deserve it. #mirrormorehopefulFollow on Twitter @mirrormorehope And follow Mirror More Hopeful on Facebook And now that sheaposs taking the fashion world by storm, Shelley hopes her daughter can help inspire other disabled children to follow their dreams no matter what. She added: My husband Jon and I are beyond excited to see what the future holds for Roni. We will do our best to help her achieve whatever path she wants to take in the future. We hope Roni can inspire other disabled children and adults to follow their dreams. Roni proves everything is achievable and donapost let things get in your way.Do you have a story to sell  Get in touch with us at yourmirror@trinitymirror .Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Burberry Inc.Downs syndromeMirror More HopefulFeel-good news" data-immediate"data-immediate"Our Pride of Britain newsletter brings you awards news and inspiring stories - dont miss out!Sign me upInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: second po ferry detained over
story: Second PO ferry is detained over safety concerns after firm sacked The Maritime and Coastguard Agency has confirmed that it is holding PO ferry The Pride of Kent following a safety inspection, after another ferry was detained last FridayThe Pride of Kent ferry has now been detained Image: PAByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsA second PO ferry has been detained following a safety inspection on the back of the firm sacking  staff so as to bring in cheaper agency workers. The Maritime and Coastguard Agencyhas said after undertaking a safety inspection it was in the process of holding The Pride of Kent on Monday.The firm sparked outrage with protests at ports around the country after getting rid of  seafarers without giving notice on March .PO boss Peter Hebblethwaite will appear before a Scottish Parliament committee on Tuesday, after he was heavily criticised over the job cuts.Now a spokesperson for the MCA confirmed that the Pride of Kent was being held.  They said: Our surveyors are in the process of detaining the Pride of Kent. We are awaiting confirmation of all the detainable items.Transport Secretary Grant Shapps confirmed the news in a tweet, adding that the ship was being held following an inspection and that safety will not be compromised.It follows the detention of another PO vessel which was held in the Northern Ireland port of Larne on Friday due to failures on crew familiarisation, vessel documentation and crew training. The Rail, Maritime and Transport union said it believed the MCA acted because of multiple safety and operational breaches, including the wearing of breathing apparatus. The union repeated its demand that the Government seize POaposs entire fleet and take action to get them back in service with the sacked crew reinstated.  General secretary Mick Lynch said: The seizing of the Pride of Kent by the MCA this evening should be adequate evidence for the Government that the gangster capitalist outfit PO are not fit and proper to run a safe service after the jobs massacre. Itaposs rare enough for the MCA to impound a ferry but PO have now had two in a week after the jobs carve up which speaks volumes about the dire state of their operation. Itaposs now high time for these important vessels to be taken over under public control with the sacked crews reinstated as the only way to get these crucial ferry routes back running safely. The MCA said another of the firmaposs vessels, European Causeway, remains under detention in Larne. Shapps wrote to Mr Hebblethwaite earlier on Monday threatening to bring a package of measures to Parliament to block the company from paying below minimum wage. Through that package, I intend to block the outcome that PO Ferries has pursued, including paying workers less than the minimum wage, he said.  The measures could be unveiled on Wednesday. The minimum wage in the UK for people aged  and above is £. per hour. Mr Hebblethwaite, whose basic annual salary is £,, told MPs on March  the average pay of the agency crew is £. per hour. He will face the Net Zero, Energy and Transport Committee on Tuesday after he appeared before a Westminster committee last week. Irish Ferries began operating on the Dover to Calais route in June  in competition with PO Ferries. A PO Ferries spokesman reportedly said: We fully welcome the Governmentaposs commitment to increasing the minimum wage for all seafarers working in British waters. From the outset, we have called for a level playing field when it comes to pay and conditions on British ferry routes. Our announcement is not about reducing seafareraposs wages, it is to enable us to have a fully flexible crewing model that allows us to meet the demands of our customers. The predicted savings we announced are not solely coming from the reduction in wages, but from removing job duplication and the benefits we will see from increased flexibility. title: uk weather forecast arctic blast
story: UK weather forecast: Arctic blast brings widespread snowfall and -C freezeA week after the UK basked in C temperatures an Arctic blast could see the mercury tumble as low as -C and there is expected to be widespread snow across the country on ThursdayArctic air is bringing freezing conditions this week Image: Getty ImagesByTim HanlonNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsBrits are set to face snow up and down the country by Thursday with Arctic air bringing lows of -C this week.After a week of hot and sunny weather where the UK had higher temperatures than the south of Spain, now a new front is moving in from the north bringing unseasonably cold conditions.People will need to wrap up warm as the icy temperatures are set to cover all parts of the country and bringing with it a carpet of snow. Maps from WXCharts show temperatures getting colder as the week goes on and spreading further south. It could get as low as -C in central Scotland while it could also be -C on the south coast of England. There are likely to be widespread snow flurries on Thursday morning, with it sticking in the South East, according to the maps, and again on Saturday where there could be up to six or seven centimetres of snow in North Wales and northern England.  Met Office forecaster Aidan McGivern said: “Much colder weather is on the way and in places there will be snow by the middle of the week.”He continued: “Another area of rain pushing south across the Northern Isles, that is a cold front and it is going to be an important feature over the next few days as it sweeps south across the country. Shetland already in the Arctic air.” It is set to be a cloudy and grey start to Tuesday morning for the east of England and rain in the north and south.  “This area across Scotland mixing with cold air could bring some sleet and snow over the high grounds but that again is a fairly weak feature, said Mr McGivern. To the north of it though much colder air arrives, C to C in the far north of Scotland while temperatures stay above average further south although not as high as they have been with a lot more cloud cover than we have been used to recently. It will get a lot colder, though going into Wednesday. Here’s the cold front by Tuesday night it has become an increasingly important feature as it potentially reactivates with the cold air to bring some snow fall to places by Wednesday and Thursday, said Mr McGivern.  For the start of Tuesday night we are going to see a lot of cloud cover, some cloud, mist and fog in place and here’s the cold front, you can see some snow on it over the Pennines, rain mainly at lower levels. It is slowly sinking south but it’s iding the country in two with a frosty start for Scotland, in parts of the far north of England behind the front, and milder further south albeit with a cloud cover and a few bits of showery rain in places. UK forecast for the next  days Turning much colder and also more unsettled this week. Today: Occasional rain across southern England clearing slowly. Fog and low cloud in central areas retreating to eastern coasts, sunny intervals and scattered showers inland. Rain moving southwards into Scotland, followed by colder weather with wintry showers in the far north. Tonight: Rain and hill snow sinking further south, followed by snow and hail showers in north and east Scotland, with a risk of ice. Further south mostly dry and cloudy. Wednesday: Rain and hill snow continuing southwards bright but distinctly cold to the north, with heavy hail and snow showers. Parts of Wales and southern England seeing sunny intervals and showers. Outlook for Thursday to Saturday: Cold for all parts with rain, sleet and snow clearing south on Thursday morning. Further wintry showers for many parts through Thursday and Friday. Turning less cold by Saturday. title: barbie house market 385000 almost
story: Barbie house on the market for £, - and almost everything is pinkA house decked out almost entirely in shades of pink is up for sale for £, in Wigan, Greater Manchester, and it looks just like the sort of place Barbie herself would enjoy livingFrom the outside, the only hint of pink is the paint on the front door and garage Image: Jam Press PurplebricksByJulia BanimAudience WriterKatie Dollard:,  Mar |commentsA striking four-bedroom house is on the market for £,, and it would make for the perfect home for anyone who has ever fancied themselves as a bit of a Barbie Girl.From the outside, the house, which is in Wigan, Greater Manchester, looks very much like other houses on the street, with the blush pink front door and garage door being the only giveaways as to what it looks like inside.Potential buyers will feel like theyaposve popped on a pair of rose-tinted glasses as they walk around the house for the first time, with shades of pink and rose used in each of the four bedrooms, as well as throughout the open plan kitchen-diner, lounge area, and office.  Get the news you want straight to your inbox.for a Mirror newsletter here. The home comes unfurnished, however, the current owners have kept the pretty pink theme throughout, with the rooms filled with pink sofas, chairs, and even a snooker table. The property even has rose gold metalwork throughout.Colour scheme aside, the house includes a number of desirable features, including four double bedrooms on the first floor. An en-suite bathroom is attached to the master bedroom, while this floor also boasts a modern - and of course, pink-themed - family bathroom.  On the ground floor, residents can enjoy luxurious underfloor heating in all tiled areas as well as a spacious family lounge with a built-in modern fireplace media ball. Double French doors lead out from the kitchen diner into the back garden, where a gazebo would help make for the sort of perfect summer parties even Pool Party Barbie herself would be happy to attend.There, unfortunately, isnapost a Malibu-esque pool for you to splash about in, however, the house does boast pretty much everything  a sociable doll about town might desire. Catered for fun evenings at home with Ken, Stacey, Skipper, or whoever  might drop by, the property most notably includes a detached garage that has been converted into a beautul bar area.Whether they be plastic or human-sized, the lucky homeowner will also benefit from off-road parking and CCTV. The house is currently on the market for £, with Purple Bricks. Do you have a property-related story to share  We pay for stories. news weird-news chemist-urges-people-not-use-"Candles could be bad for your health, warns chemistByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsCandles are a great addition to any home - not only do they make the place smell nice but they make it feel extra cosy too. But an expert has revealed they could be doing more harm than good.Dr. Dan Gubler, a PhD organic chemist, often shares health advice and tips on his TikTok @drdangublerwhere he has , followers.But his latest video, which has gone viral with . million views, has caused quite the stir as he warns people against using scented candles. In the video, he explains: There have been a lot of clinical studies that have come out recently showing that frequently burning indoor candles can cause serious health problems. For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Including inhibiting the ability of cells especially in the bladder to grow normally. When we think of pollution we think of it as an outdoor thing but indoor pollution caused by burning candles, air fresheners and other sources is a big problem. Candles are made out of cheap paraffin wax, they’re made out of articial fragrances and dyes and when we burn that it gives off carbon monoxide, carbon dioxide, sulfur dioxide Benzopyrene, and other volatile compounds. They’re not good for the body, they interfere with the body’s ability to reproduce. The problem with these candles is that there is no quality control. Candles manufacturers are not required and they do not show  per cent of their ingredients and they donapost have to prove safety. Weaposre just buying these and breathing it in and itaposs a big problem, so be careful. He adds: If you’re burning candles once in a while in a well-ventilated space I wouldn’t worry about it but chronically burning could be a big deal.Since being posted, his video has racked up almost , likes and , comments from people who were shocked by what they were hearing. One person said: Jesus. Can I have anything nice  No way thataposs crazy *lights candle,* joked another user. A third said: Itaposs literally everything. Iaposm so sick of this. CANDLES ARE MY MAIN SOURCE OF JOY. WHAT DO I HAVE LEFT  exclaimed someone .Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: customer horrified discover tattoo artist
story: Customer horried to discover tattoo artist hid their initials in designA customer took to Reddit to ask users whether they were in the wrong for being angry that their tattoo artist changed their design and secretly added in their initials Image: Getty Images fStopByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience Writer:,  Mar |commentsA customer was left fuming when they discovered their tattoo artist had secretly branded them with their initials.Sharing on Reddit, the customer revealed how they had visited a tattoo shop in their area armed with a photo of the design she wanted.The special design was a duplicate of one that their father, late grandfather, and great grandfather all had. So they requested that it looked exactly as it did in the photo. Initially, they were thrilled with the finished tattoo - until their great-grandma pointed out something odd. A few weeks later when I show my great grandmother the tattoo she grabs my arm to look at and compliment it, then asks, aposWhoaposs AJ apos For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. I ask her what she means, and she points out on the tattoo where the initials A and J or maybe T were hidden into the tattoo. Iaposm instantly p***ed, as my artistaposs name is Alice Trever [name changed]. She tries to assure me itaposs no big dealI hadnapost noticed it til now, but I still reached out to the artist sort of irritated. Unsurprisingly angry, they ed to the tattoo artist and requested a partial refund, but the artist wouldnapost back down. They told me the style of art I got is called traditional and itaposs apospretty tradapos for all artists who do that style to do it. I demanded a partial refund and they refused, so I complained to the owner who made the artist give me a full refund.Now the artist is running a full smear campaign, talking about moving shops, and all kinds of cr*p. They concluded the post by asking users whether they were in the wrong for pushing the issue, but they said she deserves more than just a refund. One person said: I would even consider suing. They kind of branded you with their initials... And they should get fired. Another put: The artist had no right to hide their initials on your skin without your consent. I would be highly upsetit was done to me. A third added: [Original poster] should do a call out campaign and try to seeany other of her clients were unknowingly aposbrandedapos just like them. Could be quite the big lawsuit...And others were shocked that the artist genuinely thought it was okay to do what they did, as one person said: This person straight up BRANDED you! Not only that, this isnapost even the artistaposs design, itaposs a copied design! While another wrote: It was not designed to have the initials there, the artist had to mody the design to do so. And itaposs not like the artist could say it was to protect their design from being copied or something since itaposs literally someone aposs design! What do you think the woman should do  Let us know in the comments.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. news weird-news i-cleaned-washing-machine-after-"TikTok user shares cleaning hack for washing machineByEmma RosemurgeyAudience Writer:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Over the last few years, a cleaning revolution has taken place on social media, with people from all over the world gaining impressive followings for sharing their hints and tricks for keeping their home clean and tidy.But regardless of whether youaposre the type of person who finds cleaning therapeutic or youaposd rather watch paint dry, itaposs fair to say weaposve all learned something along the way.Thanks to the likes of Mrs Hinch, sites like Facebook and TikTok are filled to the brim with things we never knew about how to keep our home clean - including this little washing machine hack. Washing machines quite obviously have the purpose of washing our clothes, but have you ever thought about the fact your washing machine needs to be washed too  No, I hadnapost really, either, until cleaning queen Faith Earle shared a hack on Facebook for cleaning the little drawer where the detergent goes. As someone who officially fits into the category of people who hate cleaning, it had never occurred to me that the drawerwould need to be cleaned, let alone how I would do it. However, Faithaposs recent post revealed something that lots of us didnapost know - you can actually remove the entire drawer to clean it properly, and have a good scrub around behind it. Taking to the Facebook group Cleaning tips and tricks with before and after pictures of her drawer, Faith wrote: How on earth did I not know this drawer came out !Iaposm now officially an adult and love cleaning haha! Thank you everyone for your cleaning tips and tricks. So, I decided to take a look at my own washing machine drawer, and letaposs just say the results were slightly horrying. Just like Faith said, it turned out there was a little button that allowed me to pull the drawer out completely, and what was hidden behind was an awful lot of mould and filth. I decided to soak the drawer itself in hot, soapy water, before giving it a good old scrub - but washing compartment where the drawer had been was a lot harder. To be perfectly honest, as someone who doesnapost really subscribe to the whole Mrs Hinch lestyle, I wasnapost really sure how to tackle it, but some boiling water, washing up liquid and a toothbrush made it a lot more presentable for now. Itaposs quite grim to think about all the mould that was sitting in a machine which is supposed to leave things cleaner - not more dirty - but until someone invents a self-cleaning washing machine, letaposs spread the word on keeping that pesky drawer clean.Do you have a story to share  We want to hear all about it. little-known iPhone feature that could be a game-changer for anyone whoaposs a bit stressed or those who suffer from tinnitus. If you ever struggle to fall asleep at night, you might have turned to YouTube for help and stumbled across ten-hour videos of rain hitting a window, or water in a stream.The incredibly popular videos help people disconnect from their surroundings, and can be especially helpful for those who suffer from stress, or hearing conditions such as tinnitus.But it turns out that Apple included the sounds into their software, and iPhone users can turn on the feature for free whenever they like, and a TikTok tech guru has explained how.What do you think about the iPhone trick  Let us know in the comments... TikTok user HEIMADigital shared the trick in a video, and said the feature can be used to aposmask unwanted environmental noiseapos.To turn on the feature, you have to open the Settings app, then go to Accessibility, scroll down to Audio Visual, then tap aposbackground soundsapos. There youaposll be able to turn on the feature and select which type of sound you would like, with options including ocean, rain, and stream. Apple said the feature can minimise distractions and help you to focus, be calm or rest. title: pilot shares worst time fly
story: Pilot shares worst time to fly for nervous travellers - and where to sit on planeJerry Johnson, an airline pilot from Los Angeles, in the US, has revealed the worst time to flyyoure a nervous traveller as its likely theyd expect more "bumpier air"ByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience WriterChristine YounanSenior Lestyle and Travel Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |commentsBeing afraid of flying is one of the most common phobias.In fact, it is believed that one in  of the population is affected byit, according to Anxiety UK.Whether itaposs the turbulence, the landings, take-offs, claustrophobia, heights or bad weather, there are a number of things that can trigger the anxiety that comes with flying. If this sounds like you, youaposll be pleased to know a pilot has some advice to make the journey that bit easier.Jerry Johnson, an airline pilot from Los Angeles, US, has revealed the worst time of the day to flyyouaposre a nervous traveller, reports Daily Star.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here.He shared his flight secrets and top tips with Readeraposs Digest where he said thereaposs a time of the day to avoid a bumpy ride.Jerry revealed: If youaposre a nervous flyer, book a morning flight. The heating of the ground later causes bumpier air, and itaposs much more likely to thunderstorm in the afternoon. Another anonymous pilot also suggested that passengers should sit in the backthey always feel cold.The cabin crew member, who works in Texas, said: The general flow of air in any airplane is from front to back. They added: Soyouaposre concerned about breathing the freshest possible air or not getting too hot, sit as close to the front. Planes are generally warmest in the back. For a smooth ride, sit over or near the wing pilot Patrick Smith says. The bumpiest place is in the back. A plane is like a seesaw. If youaposre in the middle, you donapost move as much, he revealed.He also reassured readers that turbulence isnapost dangerous and that itaposs impossible for it to cause the plane to crash. Patrick added: Pilots find it perplexing that so many people are afraid of turbulence. Itaposs all but impossible for turbulence to cause a crash. We avoid turbulence not because weaposre afraid the wing is going to fall off but because itaposs annoying.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: women swear 13p kitchen item
story: Women swear by p kitchen item for flawless streak-free fake tanA woman took to Facebook to share a fake tanning hack that impressed her so much shes vowed to never use a mitt again - and other group members vouch that it works Image: Getty ImagesByPaige HollandShowbiz Audience WriterRachel Pugh:,  Mar |commentsFake tan does more than give you that Iaposve spent two weeks somewhere exotic, glow. It also saves you valuable time in the morning and instantly lts your complexion. Butonly it wasnapost so hard to get right... Well now, your streak-free tanning prayers have been answered, as apparently, the secret is hiding in your kitchen cupboard.A beauty lover came across the hack on Facebook and was so impressed by the results that she made the bold claim that sheaposd never use a mitt again, reports Manchester Evening News. The woman shared the hack in the Make-Up Tips and Tricks for Women Over  group on Facebook, where she wrote: So I saw a tip on a dferent Facebook group about applying fake tan with a latex glove instead of the usual tanning mitt.For more of the news you care about, straight to your inbox, sign up for one of our daily newsletters here. Just to let you lovely lot know that I’ve tried it and couldn’t be happier with the results!! Streak-free, even tan. Will never use a mitt again! Her post was quickly inundated with replies from women who found the same thing. One person said: I did it that way for years. Couldnapost bring myself to try the mitt even though they kept sending me one. Another wrote: This is the only way I’ve done it. I feel like it’s easier to tell where I’ve applied it and how much. A third added: I’ve been doing it this way for  years. Then a smooth makeup sponge for my hands  fingers. Perfect results each time!That’s how I do it! Great, even coverage every time! commented another user. While someone  put: I’ve been applying mine with a latex glove for a few years, I love how even it goes on.The hack was put to the test by the Hondrou Twins on TikTok @hondroutwinsofficialin a video that has since racked up . million views.In the clip, the creator compared the results you get when tanning with a mitt vs with latex gloves - and you can see thereaposs a huge dference.She begins by putting fake tan on her legs - using a mitt for one leg, and a latex glove for the other. While the latex glove leg looks streak-free, the mitt leg does look a little patchy and was harder to blend. Viewers were quick to point out how much more flawless it looks with the glove. ASDA sells a packet of  disposable latex gloves for £. which works out to approximately p each, but you can also pick them up cheaper in other stores like Home Bargains or BM. Try it for yourself and let us know in the comments what you think.Have you got a story to share We want to hear all about it. title: woman sets new world record
story: Woman sets new world record by scoffing most chicken nuggets in a minuteLeah Shutkever flew past the previous record when she snaffled an impressive  McDonalds chicken nuggets in  seconds, with the nuggets weighing in at a total of gLeah Shutkever smashed the world record for most chicken nuggets eaten in a minute Image: Guiness World RecordsByLucas CumiskeyKit Roberts:,  Mar |commentsA British woman has trounced the competition and set a new world record for the most chicken nuggets eaten in one minute. Leah Shutkever smashed through the previous record when she scoffed down  of the poultry treats in the allotted time. The chicken gobbled by serial record-breaker Shutkever had an impressive total weight of g. Her efforts obliterated the record set by fellow competitive eater Nela Zissar, who managed to snarf a mind-boggling g of nuggets in . But Leah didnapost stop at the sprint section of nugget-eating, also setting a new record for the most nuggets put away in three minutes, a test of endurance as much as speed.  In  she managed to chow down on .g of nuggets in  seconds. This edged past the previous record of g, which had been held by fellow Brit Thomas Welborn. Leah, from the West Mids, set her latest nugget achievement while backstage at the Guinness World Records Italian TV show, Lo Show Dei Records, in Milan.  The good egg holds a slew of world gongs for eating quickly, including her  accolade for fastest time to ingest three mince pies . She also crammed down three pickled eggs in a record . seconds in  and ate eight tomatoes in a minute in . The foodie also set records for eating a muffin in . seconds and for devouring the most marshmallows in a minute by eating , using no hands for either. title: woman tells how skin started
story: Womans skin suddenly started to bleed and ooze after stopping eczema treatmentNicola Barton, from Glasgow, had been applying steroid cream to treat the eczema with good results, but had a violent reaction when she stopped using the treatment for the skin conditionNicola Barton was left with oozing skin as a result of eczema Image: Jam Press Nicola BartonByAmy WaltersKit Roberts:,  Mar |comments A woman has revealed the stomach-churning symptoms she has endured after she stopped using eczema creams - including her skin sticking to her bedsheets after it began aposoozingapos.Nicola Barton, , started to experience symptoms of eczema when she was only four years old, saying she would have to dress up aposlike a mummyapos each evening to help with the itching.After being prescribed steroid creams and using them sparingly the condition was reduced to a few patches on her arms.However after Nicola, a receptionist from Glasgow, turned  the eczema started to flare up again.She had just ed home from a trip to Australia, and thinks the sudden change in temperature could have been a factor in the condition worsening. Doctors once again prescribed Nicola steroid creams, and despite providing some initial relief the eczema proved more stubborn. “I started researching on my own because what the doctors could do wasn’t working at all,” Nicola said. I had some really aggressive, painful patches and I didn’t realise it was eczema again. The steroids took away the eczema almost immediately, but would always come back more aggressive.“I used things like shea butter, jojoba oil and vitamin E oil on my skin instead of moisturisers with chemicals in them and these helped a lot. “I was learning a bit more about alternatives to synthetic treatments, but hadn’t learned about topical steroid withdrawalat this point, so still used the weak steroids.”In January , she discovered people on Instagram who had been documenting their journey with TSW – an adverse reaction to discontinuing steroids after a period of usage. As she wasn’t using very strong steroids, Nicola thought that the condition wouldn’t affect her, so she continued to use her medication. But struggling to cope with the painful condition, she decided to stop using the creams once and for all in November . Quickly, her skin deteriorated dramatically. Nicola said: “I started to flare, ooze, crack, swell and bleed within a few days of stopping.“Initially, it felt like out-of-control eczema and just kept spreading, then within a couple of days the other symptoms started. “My skin would ooze wherever I had patches of inflamed and painful skin, which eventually ended up being most of my body after a couple of weeks. “I was aware [of the symptoms] because of the people who decided to document their healing process online, but I was convinced my withdrawal wouldn’t be that bad.“It was so incredibly dry, that I could barely move my joints and I couldn’t fully close my hands, bend my knees and elbows or even turn my head because my neck would crack, bleed and ooze. “My body stopped regulating its temperature, so I’d be sweating when I wasn’t hot and I lost my appetite, where I lost lbs.” Nicola began losing her hair and believes she lost over half during her ordeal, which she cut short due to it being so thin.  As her ears used to crack and ooze, they would end up sticking to the pillow and because her skin was so itchy, she couldn’t find a comfy way to sleep. Although she didn’t feel great about her appearance, her mental health has taken the biggest toll. Nicola said: “I was in so much pain and discomfort and just wanted my skin to feel better again.“I would happily look like this foreverI could just feel better. Obviously I’d rather not have all my skin open for the rest of my le, but at the time I’d have taken any relief. “It was without a doubt the worst experience of my le, as it was incredibly traumatic and there was never a single second where I felt comfortable or pain free. “I didn’t want to deal with it and looking back on it, I have no idea how I actually got through it – especially because I had no idea when it would end.“I barely left my house during the worst, but I was asked a couple of timesI was contagious and was told by the doctor that I looked like I had ‘elephant skin.’ “My partner, Jack Jones, , has been amazing and is one the reasons I managed to make it through each day. “He was basically my carer when I lost the ability to do most things, as he washed my hair, helped brush my teeth and bandaged me every night without fail.“I have a lot of sympathy for those [caring for others with TSW] because it isn’t easy watching your loved one go through such a traumatic experience.” Nicola believes that the experience has made self-acceptance easier for her and as she’s now  months free of steroid use, she feels more comfortable in her looks than ever before. She added: “Right now, my skin is better than it was before and even though I have scars and wrinkly skin, I think I look absolutely fine.“I still get flare-ups of dry, itchy skin in the cold weather which scares me and I start to worry I’m going to go through it again. “I don’t blame doctors and I know that’s a common feeling, as they’re doing what they were taught to do – but it annoys me when some refuse to listen. “Steroids have always been the treatment for eczema, so it’s hard to change minds, but all they have to do is look at how many people have gone through this and got better by doing nothing to our skin. “It isn’t a coincidence that we all get better eventually once we stop steroids, as topical steroid withdrawal isn’t eczema.” Read MoreRead More Most Read Dont MissFollow MirrorFacebookTwitterComment MORE ON Jack JonesMental healthVitaminsElephantsSteroidsHealth" data-immediate"data-immediate"Get our daily health briefing with all the news you need to know direct to your inboxInvalid EmailSomething went wrong, please try again later.We use your sign-up to provide content in ways youve consented to and to improve our understanding of you. title: inside putins bond style armoured
story: Inside Putin’s Bond-style armoured car built to resist chemical attacks and bombsAlthough the exact cost of the car has not been revealed by the Kremlin, the huge Aurus Kortezh was part of the m Kortezh project - equivalent to £mThe car is designed to protect everyone inside Image: Getty ImagesByKelly-Ann MillsNews Reporter:,  Mar |commentsRussian leader Vladimir Putin travels around in an armoured car likened to something James Bond would drive, and akin to the Beast driven by the President of the United States. Designed to protect those inside the huge Aurus Kortezh limousine has an emergency exit through the boot and is able to be completely submerged in water. Although the exact cost of the car has not been revealed by the Kremlin, it was part of the m Kortezh project - equivalent to £m.It was unveiled during Putinaposs inauguration in May  and was designed and made in Russia, with commercial versions of the car going on sale to the public six months later. Putinaposs version is a six-tonne armoured version which is ft long can resist chemical gas attacks, bombs and gunfire. It also has a .litre V engine, reinforce glass, run-flat tyres, night vision cameras and is said to be able to move the passengers seats inside to a safer positiona collision is inevitable. When it was first unveiled as Putin was driven to the Kremlin to be sworn in, it was compared to then US President Donald Trumpaposs armoured car nicknamed The Beast.Putinaposs car was cm longer although had a smaller engine - with Trumpaposs at .litres and weighing in two tonnes heavier at eight tonnes. The Beast - or Cadillac One - also has supplies of the Presidentaposs blood and a le support machine, as well as being described as a personalised moving fortress with its near-indestructible structure and chassis.  The seven-seater limousine is loaded with weaponry in case of an attack, with tear gas cannon are located within the rear bumper to debilitate anyone pursuing the car and despite the president always being accompanied by armed Secret Service members in a motorcade, the car reportedly has a pump-action shotgun inside at all times. It cost around .m - or £.m. It is not known how many versions of the Putinaposs Aurus Kortezh exist, but the US say they have  versions of Cadillac One all fitted to the same specications. title: worse come putin after peace
story: Worse to come from Putin after peace talk delegates poisoned, expert warnsProfessor Michael Osterholm has warned Western leaders to bolster their preparations for a biological and chemical attack after Roman Abramovich and two members of the Ukraine peace talks were allegedly poisonedVladimir Putin seemingly has no qualms about using chemical weapons against his foes, an expert said Image: Getty ImagesByMatthew DreschNews Reporter:,  Mar Updated:,  Mar |comments Russiaaposs alleged poisoning of Roman Abramovich and other members of the Ukraine peace talks is a warning sign for the future, an expert said.Professor Michael Osterholm, an infectious disease expert, urged Western leaders to aposbolsterapos preparations for a biological and chemical attack following the suspected attack.The University of Minnesota academic warned that Vladimir Putin could also target political foes with his arsenal of deadly illegal weapons.It comes after Russian oligarch Mr Abramovich was allegedly poisoned alongside two Ukrainian peace negotiators earlier this month. The trio suffered symptoms including red eyes, painful tearing and peeling skin following their meeting in Kyiv. The professor warned that chemical weapons could also be used by Russia to break the stalemate in Ukraine. He added: However implausible a biological or chemical attack once seemed, the United States and its NATO allies need to game out the worst-case scenarios, take inventory of the resources they have at their collective disposal to deal with biological and chemical attacks, and swtly bolster those resources.Just a few weeks ago, the notion that Russia might use such weapons in its campaign in Ukraine would have seemed unduly alarmist. That is no longer the case.  Prof Osterholm added that Putin also aposseemingly has no compunctionapos about using banned weapons against his political enemies. The academic said biological and chemical weapons can achieve in war what bombs and bullets cannot - by reaching civilians hiding in shelters. He warned that poisonous gas could leave areas of Ukraine uninhabitable, while weaponised diseases could spread across the world. It comes after Russian opposition leader Alexei Navalny was poisoned with Novichok - just like former Kremlin spy Sergei Skripal and his daughter Yulia.  The father and daughter were attacked in Salisbury in , while Mr Navalny was poisoned in . In , Putin critic and ex-spy Alexander Litvinenko died in London after being poisoned with radioactive polonium-. Now Cha owner Abramovich, , has allegedly been poisoned while taking part in Ukraine peace talks. The suspected attack has been blamed on hard-liners in Moscow who wanted to foil talks to end the war.  It remains unclear what has caused the symptoms, which may have been triggered by a chemical or biological agent, or a form of electromagnetic-radiation attack. An investigation into the incident was launched by Christo Grozev and a German forensic team was brought in to perform examinations. However, too much time passed between the initial poisoning and these tests, so the suspected poison was unable to be detected. Mr Grozev concluded that the attack was a warning rather than an attempt to kill negotiators. Want all the latest news and analysis from Ukraine to our World News Bulletin here Mr Abramovich - who took over at Stamford Bridge in  - is said to have travelled back and forth from Moscow, Lviv and other negotiating venues as part of his role in talks, which his spokesperson confirmed on  February. I can confirm that Roman Abramovich was contacted by the Ukrainian side for support in achieving a peaceful resolution, and that he has been trying to help ever since, a statement read. Considering what is at stake, we would ask for your understanding as to why we have not commented on neither the situation as such nor his involvement. Thank you.
